channel.title: Romeo and Juliet
channel.description:
Alright I am fed up with old english, but I have to do it since Im already failing english(Im not joking, it's an evil teacher, seriosuly).
Well we have a test on Act 2 and 3 tomorrow, I still don't understand them. From what I can gather after reading them both twice, Romeo and Juliet have gotten married, Tybalt and Mercutio have a duel, mercutio dies so Romeo kills tybalt to avenge mercutio. And Juliet's parents still are unaware that she is married to romeo, and they are going to force her to marry some fag named Paris. Thats all I can figure out, but there must be much more that I am missing?
Could someone pinpoint some important information for me? My mark in english is a 45 right now(Not because I am stupid though). So, if you could perhaps tell me a few important things that happened in ACT 2 & 3 then that would be awesome!
Thanks!
[Dont read unless your interested] Oh and if your wondering about my english mark, she seriously has something against me just because she and my mom got in an arguement one time. It started out because she gave me like a 50 something on a test, and my parents were looking at the test and she didn't mark an entire page so I was supposed to have a high 60 in the end. The teacher gladly changed my mark, but my mom took it far by yelling at her and started telling her she should lose her job, blah blah blah. Ever since then the teacher really hates me. She kicks me out of class like 2 or 3 times a week because I am sanitary and wear deoderant, she then tells the princapal that I am wearing perfume(which your not allowed) and I usually get in crap. No matter what deod I where or how much I put on she'll still do this, and of course the principal takes her side. She keeps the windows open in wintertime, and I sit right at the window and when I close it she kicks me out. It was fucking -30 degrees celcius, and she had the windows open, and it was during a test so I got a 0 after she kicked me out. At the end of two weeks we hand in our homework and she makes sure it's done and stuff, TWICE she has claimed I never handed it in, even though I did. So as you can see she is a total bitch just because my mom got mad at her one time. Not really my fault. Anyways if you actually read all this, then could you please keep it on-topic about romeo and juliet? [/rant]

item.title: Romeo and Juliet
item.dc:creator: @jme jme

@jme wrote:

[quote=“Shinoda, post:26, topic:2004”][quote author=iruleatants link=topic=2095.msg20407#msg20407 date=1146266975]
lol, makes it so you can understand whats going on, i mean i have an iq of 193 but i still cant understand some of it, its all stupid to me.
[/quote]

Then you must have extremely low analytical skills compared to the average 7th grader.

I base that statement on the fact that in my 7th grade class not one single person had the slightest spot of trouble analyzing and understanding this play.

It really is not all that complicated.[/quote]

iruleeatants is a retard anyways,

But are you sure it’s not a simplified version? The reading in this is at the grade 10 level. Or maybe your teacher explains everything? Btw, this is like a month old I had my test a loong time ago, I dont think I need anymore help Now we’re reading some bullshit called lord of the flies.

item.title: Romeo and Juliet
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

Basic synopsis is roughly the same as the myth of Pyramus and Thisbe, which it was based upon. Alternatley, use West Side Story as a modern-day retelling (although I don't advise it).

People fall in love, their romance is doomed because their families are in a feud. There is a fight, and Romeo kills someone. As a result he must leave the city, and so he and Juliet plan to run away together and elope. Juliet talks to the helpful friar, who gives her a potion that will make her appear as one dead. She takes the potion, and her family believes that she has died. They bury her, and two messengers, one from the friar, one from Romeo's friends, are sent to him, both with different stories of what happened. Guess who reaches him first? (Yes, the messenger from his friends/Juliet's family, who says that Juliet died) Romeo, devastated, goes to Juliet's tomb, lies down beside her, and drinks a vial of poison. Juliet awakes shortly thereafter, sees Romeo dead beside her, and kills herself despairing with his sword/dagger.

Read full topic
